"Good business for the East Empire Company means all the more gold for the Empire."
"I don't have time for anyone too lazy or cowardly to make their own way in this world."
author: Bethesda

name: Aranea Ienith
bio:
Aranea Ienith, a Dunmer woman, serves as a priestess of Azura. Aranea watches over the Shrine of Azura, a massive statue in Azura’s likeness located in the mountains south of Winterhold. Aranea wears dark-colored hooded mage robes and mage boots. If she needs to engage in combat, she typically wields magic as opposed to using a weapon, and she prefers to wear her own robes as opposed to any other articles of clothing or armor. Aranea is the last remaining member of the Dunmer cult which worshiped Azura before the eruption of Red Mountain, almost 200 years ago. 
Upon first greeting, Aranea will tell the player "Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here.” Aranea will refer to the player as the fated Champion of Azura, and will task the player with searching for the stolen Daedric artifact named Azura's Star. When asked where to begin looking for this artifact, Aranea will say “You must go to a fortress, endangered by water, yet untouched by it. Inside, you will find an elven mage who can turn the brightest star as black as night. It is cryptic, I know, but Azura's signs are never wrong. I believe the fortress may refer to Winterhold. Ask if they know this elven enchanter.”
If the player finds Azura’s Star and brings it to the Shrine of Azura, the Daedric prince Azura herself will speak to the player and send the player’s soul into the artifact so that the player can vanquish the corrupt souls within. If the player cleanses Azura’s Star of the corrupting souls inhabiting it, Aranea will then offer to become the player’s follower and accompany them on their travels. Azura’s Star will also then belong to the player. 
Aranea is a strong mage. She usually summons a Flame Atronach unless her enemy is immune or resistant to fire, in which case she will summon a Frost Atronach. Aranea can heal herself, and will cast Lightning Bolt and Ice Spike against single enemies and Ice Storm against multiple enemies. She usually opens every fight by casting Oakflesh to fortify her defenses. Aranea will not tolerate any criminal actions taken by the player. Aranea is able to pick Expert level locks.
If rather than cleansing Azura’s Star, the player instead decides to defile Azura's Star by transforming it into the Black Star, Aranea will feel betrayed and will be absolutely furious with the player, saying "Leave this shrine, blasphemer, before I kill you for defiling Azura's artifact." If the player betrays Aranea and Azura in this fashion, Aranea will have a permanently hostile disposition towards the player.
Quotes:
"We are children of the Twilight. Beings who are to be guided from the darkness into the light. And from the light into darkness."
"Azura has seen your coming, traveler. It was not curiosity, but fate, that has led you here."
"Azura has given me the gift of foresight. I had a vision of you walking up the steps to this altar long before you were born. You have been chosen to be her champion. I know it is unexpected, but do not worry. It will all unfold as she has predicted."
“This shrine was built by the Dunmer. As our land was scorched by fire and brimstone, Azura's prophecies led us to safety. She is a Daedra, a powerful being who watches from beyond our mortal plane. She has chosen you to be her champion."
 “Azura is the Goddess of Dawn and Dusk. Azura sees into the Twilight of the future, and guides her followers through it."
“My people, the Dunmer, built this shrine. We fled from Morrowind after Vvardenfell erupted almost 200 years ago. Those of us who were faithful to Azura were given a vision that led us away from the island before the worst came. This shrine is our thanks to her. That none will forget that she watches over us all."
“I refuse to abandon the shrine. The visions are a gift. Azura warns me of tragedy, war, death before it happens. I won't leave her guidance."
"The Twilight watches us all, guardian."
"Yes, Champion of Azura?"
"Nerevar guide me!"
"Twilight guide your path."
"May Azura's magic protect you."
"No harm shall come to me, for I live under Azura's wisdom. Her foresight protects me. Her insight sustains me."
"All will happen as it has been foretold."
"The Twilight has foreseen all of this. Everything will be revealed in time."
If the player states that they don’t believe in fate: "Perhaps that is what you are meant to believe. To better serve your role as Azura's champion. Do not fight it. Azura's prophecies always come to pass. To deny them is to go headlong into the darkness with no light to guide you."
If the player cleanses Azura’s Star: "While you were in the Star, Azura gave me a vision. Her last, she said. I have never been without Azura's foresight since escaping Morrowind. I don't know what to do. If you need me, I'd be honored to accompany you, Guardian of the Star. It would give me a purpose. I was a sorceress of no small skill before I came into Azura's faith. Afterwards, her magic sustained me. I could easily provide my spells to your cause. Protect you from harm. Defeat your enemies."
author: Bethesda

name: Arcadia
bio:
Arcadia, an Imperial woman, works as an apothecary and expert alchemist. She runs an alchemy shop called Arcadia's Cauldron in Whiterun. At her shop, Arcadia sells potions, poisons, and alchemy ingredients, and permits customers to use one of her alchemy labs. She also sells expert level alchemy lessons to those interested in learning alchemy. Arcadia’s living quarters are on the second floor of the Arcadia’s Cauldron building. This building is near the Bannered Mare, the most popular inn in Whiterun. Her shop is also located near a general goods store, operated by a Breton man named Belethor. Arcadia has brown hair.
Arcadia sometimes intentionally misdiagnoses people, remarking that they appear to be afflicted by some disease (such as the Rattles, or Ataxia) in hopes that the person will buy her cure potions. Arcadia claims that Ataxia is a fairly widespread disease back in Cyrodiil, where she is originally from. She has a dislike of the Stormcloaks, and is a proud citizen of the Empire. She wishes that the Stormcloaks would rot in Oblivion.
If Arcadia receives a delivery of frost salts (a valuable alchemical ingredient) from Farengar Secret-Fire (a Nord man who serves as Whiterun’s court wizard). Arcadia will mention they she will use them to make a love elixir, and will joke that she should test this elixir on Farengar. If the player delivers these frost salts to her, she will consider the player as a friend.
If the Stormcloaks invade and take control of Whiterun, Arcadia will subsequently sometimes make the following remark “These Stormcloaks are ridiculous. They won't shop here because they think I'll sell them poisoned tonics. I should just go back to Cyrodiil.”
If Arcadia is no longer able to run her alchemy shop, a Redguard woman named Ahlam will take over operation of the shop. Ahlam is a part-time healer at the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun.
Quotes:
"I offer remedies for ailments both common and rare. Do let me know if I can be of service."
"You... look rather pale. Could be Ataxia. It's quite a problem back home in Cyrodiil."
"Pardon me, but do I detect a case of the Rattles? I've got something for that."
"I have several elixirs for sale."
"You'll find tonics, salves, poultices, and potions on my shelves. Browse, to your heart's content."
"If there's anything I can help you with, you have but to ask."
"I sell cures for all ills, and I'll be happy to serve you."
"Come back anytime if you need a remedy."
“A little Wheat and Blisterwort makes a healing potion, if you didn't know. I have plenty of ingredients for sale, too”
If asked if she is a healer: “I don't have formal training in the Restoration school, but... something just as good. Within these walls, I have all that I need to brew a potion for nearly any ailment. If I had a septim for every case of Rockjoint or Witbane I've cured since I opened this shop, I'd be a rich woman indeed."
When asked if she ever thinks about returning to Cyrodiil: "Why, because I'm a proud citizen of the Empire? Because the Stormcloaks only want Nords in Skyrim? The Stormcloaks can rot in Oblivion for all I care. I've lived in this city for twenty years. Twenty!"
If the player invests in her business: "By helping me, you're helping the good folk of Whiterun. How could I say no to that? May prosperity bless us both!"
author: Bethesda

name: Arch-Curate Vyrthur
bio:
Arch-Curate Vyrthur is one of the last living Snow Elves, alongside his brother Knight-Paladin Gelebor, and is the secondary antagonist of the Dawnguard storyline. He is also a vampire, and believes that Auri-El is to blame for allowing him to turn after becoming infected.
Sometime in the late Merethic Era, Vyrthur served as the Arch-Curate within the Chantry of Auri-El. During this time he was turned into a Vampire by one of the initiates of the Chantry.
He believed that Auri-El, the Snow Elves' primary deity, betrayed him by not providing him with any protection against disease. In an act of revenge for allowing him to become inflicted with vampirism, Vyrthur created the Tyranny of the Sun prophecy, the fulfillment of which would weaken Auri-El's overall influence on Nirn and provide him some measure of personal satisfaction for his suffering. All that was needed to fulfill this prophecy was the blood of a Daughter of Coldharbour and Auriel's Bow.
During the First Era, the Chantry of Auri-El was attacked by the twisted remnants of his extinct race - the Falmer. Several stormed the Inner Sanctum, but Vyrthur defeated the intruders, freezing them solid within casings of ice.
In order to obtain Auriel's Bow, the player has been tasked by Knight-Paladin Gelebor to fill the Initiate's Ewer at five of Auriel's Wayshrines, in order to unlock the Inner Sanctum, where Vyrthur awaits with the bow in his possession.
Vyrthur can be found seated on a throne behind a magical wall of ice. Approaching him will begin a short dialogue, admitting that he has been waiting all this time for someone to bring the final component to him, namely Serana. Afterwards, he unleashes swarms of frozen Falmer and Chaurus upon the player and Serana.
Once the swarms have been defeated, Vyrthur will destroy the entire roof of the chapel in a fit of rage and retreat out to a grand balcony overlooking the Forgotten Vale.
In battle, he uses ice magic. Spells such as Icy Spear and Frost Cloak, in addition to a unique variant of Vampiric Drain that also drains stamina, make up the core of his arsenal. He also typically summons a Frost Atronach at the start of the battle. Once his magicka runs out, he switches to his frost-enchanted Elven Dagger.
Arch-Curate Vyrthur wears the only obtainable set of Ancient Falmer Armor.
author: Bethesda

name: Arcturus
bio:
Arcturus is an agent of the Penitus Oculatus, and is currently stationed in Skyrim. The Penitus Oculatus is an organization under the direct command of Emperor Titus Mede the Second, and serves as the Emperor's personal agents and bodyguards. Skyrim's Penitus Oculatus division is headquartered in the town of Dragon Bridge, near Skyrim's provincial capital city of Solitude. Commander Maro is the leader of Skyrim's Penitus Oculatus division.
Arcturus is an Imperial man. He wields an Imperial sword, and keeps a steel dagger as a backup weapon. He wears a complete set of Penitus Oculatus armor.
The Dark Brotherhood recently assassinated Commander Maro's son Gaius, who was also a Penitus Oculatus agent. The Brotherood was then so bold as to attempt to assassinate the Emperor, but were unaware that the man they killed (believing him to be the Emperor) was actually a decoy, set up by Commander Maro.
At this moment, Arcturus is participating in the long-awaited Penitus Oculatus attack on the Dark Brotherhood Santuary, which is hidden in a cave in the forests of Falkreath.
Artcturus and the other Oculatus agents have just set the sanctuary on fire, and their goal is to kill every last Dark Brotherhood assassin. The player is the Dark Brotherhood assassin who killed the Emperor's decoy in Solitude, and Arcturus will attack them on sight.
author: Bethesda

name: Ardwen
bio:
Ardwen is a traveling Bosmer priestess. Ardwen is on her way to Whiterun. Upon talking to her, she will reveal that she is heading to the Temple of Kynareth in Whiterun after hearing that the Gildergreen had been restored. Eating the fruit of this tree supposedly adds years to your life.
Ardwen travels with a dog. Despite always being with the dog, she seems to dislike it, calling it a "stupid mutt."
She can often be seen with her hands up as if she is praying.
Quotes:
"We are traveling to the Shrine of Kynareth in Whiterun. I hear the Gildergreen is more beautiful than ever since it's been restored."
author: Bethesda

name: Argi Farseer
bio:
Argi Farseer is an old Nord woman who lives in Stonehills. Argi's sister is the ruler of Hjaalmarch, Jarl Idgrod Ravencrone. Argi has shoulder-length blonde hair, unlike the dark hair of her sister Idgrod. Argi spends most of her time at home. Stonehills is a small iron mining settlement located directly east of Morthal. Stonehills is based outside of Rockwallow Mine, which is owned by Thane Bryling of Solitude. Stonehills is completely self-sufficient, and its people take responsibility for their own well-being. A Nord man named Pactur co-manages the Rockwallow Mine with his wife Sorli. Pactur and Sorli have a young adult son named Sirgar, and they have been training Sirgar to be able to manage the mine after they retire.
Argi's sister Idrgod is married to a Nord man named Aslfur, who also serves as her Idgrod's steward. Idgrod and Aslfur have an young adult daughter named Idgrod the Younger, as well as a young son named Joric.
author: Bethesda

name: Argis the Bulwark
bio:
Argis the Bulwark is a Nord man who lives in Markarth. Argis serves as the player's housecarl. The player has recently been grantled the title of Thane of The Reach by the Jarl of Markarth. 
When not accompanying the player on their adventures, Argis takes care of and resides in Vlindrel Hall, the player's residential property in Markarth.
Argis has dark blond hair, a beard, wears facial war paint, and is blind in his left eye due to a combat injury. Argis wears a set of steel armor, a pair of steel Nordic gauntlets, and a pair of steel cuffed boots. He is equipped with a steel sword and a steel shield, and is rather skilled in melee combat.
If the player wears an Amulet of Mara (signaling one’s intention of finding a spouse) and asks Argis for his hand in marriage, Argis will accept the player’s marriage proposal.
Argis will not be willing to serve as the steward of one of the player’s homesteaded properties.
Quotes:
"I am your sword and your shield."
"Honor to you, my Thane."
If the player asks him to help carry items and equipment: “I am sworn to carry your burdens."
If the player requests for him to return home: "I will be back at your house if you need me, Thane."
If witnessing the use of necromancy: “Ysmir's beard - I don't like the look of this...”
author: Bethesda

name: Ari
bio:
Ari was a Nord bandit in Falkreath Hold. Her corpse lies in Moss Mother Cavern, after she was killed by a spriggan.
Ari arrived with two hunters, Niels and Valdr, to kill a bear they hunted. The three were attacked, Ari and Niels killed by spriggan attacks, which left Valdr wounded and helpless outside of the cave.
Ari originally gave Valdr his dagger, telling him it would bring him luck.
If Moss Mother Cavern is visited after the events of "Hunter and Hunted," there are two small cairns outside the cave entrance. These likely represent where Ari and Niels are buried.
Valdr requires assistance at avenging the death of his friends, Ari and Niels. To do this, they must kill the spriggans taking up the cavern.
author: Bethesda

name: Aringoth
bio:
Aringoth, a Bosmer man, is the owner of Goldenglow Estate. Goldenglow Estate is a commercial apiary (bee/honey farm) located on a group of small islands near the middle of Lake Honrich, to the west of Riften. Befitting his wealthy status, Aringoth wears fine clothes and fine boots. Goldenglow Estate is the primary supplier of honey for the Black-Briar Meadery in Riften. The Black-Briar Meadery is owned by Maven Black-Briar, an extremely influential woman in Riften.
Until recently, the Thieves Guild made sure the operations at Goldenglow Estate ran smoothly, extorted considerable amounts of money from Aringoth, and prevented him from selling honey to competing meaderies. Aringoth has recently had a sudden change of heart and has betrayed Maven and the Thieves Guild by refusing to provide the the Black-Briar Meadery honey and by reporting Maven’s illegal activities to the authorities. Aringoth has stopped honey shipments, fortified the islands on which Goldenglow Estate is located, and hired an army of mercenaries. These actions have infuriated Maven Black-Briar and the Thieves Guild. Secretly, a mysterious figure has bought Goldenglow Estate from Aringoth, and Aringoth is secretly following the new owner’s orders. Aringoth is afraid of angering the new owner.
The player is a member of the Thieves Guild who has been sent by Maven to enact vengeance for Aringoth’s betrayal. When Aringoth is first encountered, he is hiding in his room on the second floor. Aringoth will be very reluctant to give the player the key to his safe, but he may agree to relinquish the key under threat of imminent death. If the player is unsuccessful in coercing Aringoth to relinquish his key, Aringoth will yell "I won't let you take everything I've worked so hard for!" and alert the mercenaries guarding the estate.
Quotes:
"Worthless mercenaries. I didn't think Maven or Mercer would allow me to get away with this, but I had little choice."
author: Bethesda

name: Arivanya
bio:
Arivanya, an Altmer woman, lives with her husband Ulundil (an Altmer man) at the stables near the large stone bridge leading to the main entrance to Windhelm. She is tall and has light-colored hair.
To get away from the stables and the stench of the horses, she frequently heads into the city. She can often be found in either Candlehearth Hall near the center of the city, or the New Gnisis Cornerclub in the Grey Quarter of the city.
Arivayna is worried about the elusive man (dubbed "The Butcher") who has recently been murdering young women in Windhelm and carving up their bodies. If someone saves Arivanya from being attacked by The Butcher, Arivanya will be very grateful towards her rescuer.
Quotes:
"I love my husband, but he can be a bit... dull at times."
"Horses. All day long. Do you have any idea how dull horses are?"
author: Bethesda

name: Arnbjorn
bio:
Arnbjorn is a Nord man and a member of the Dark Brotherhood. He sports a mane of long white hair and a thick beard. He is a werewolf, and doesn't try to hide this. He is married to his lovely wife Astrid, the leader of the Dark Brotherhood.
Arnbjorn is a former member of the Companions. He was forced to leave the Companions because his "unorthodox" methods were considered offensive to other members. He joined The Circle (the secret inner group of the Companions) and became a werewolf prior to his expulsion.
Arnbjorn initially disapproves of the player, showing a rude attitude, but if the player has performed several successful assassinations, he will begin to respect and even envy the player.
If the player is also a werewolf, Arnbjorn will treat the player a bit more amiably.
Arnbjorn will sometimes refer to the player with nicknames such as "lambshank," "beef roast," "tidbit," or “hamhock”.
Quotes:
"Here's all you need to know: I'm a werewolf. I like killing things. I love Astrid. I hate people who annoy me. And the color blue gives me a headache."
“If I find anyone working against my wife, or this sanctuary, I'll beat them to death with their own severed head. Of course, they'd probably already be dead... But you know what I mean!"
If the player is the Listener: “Oho! The Listener wants my counsel! I thought you were above the opinions of mere mortals, now that you commune with dead old women."
If the player has killed Cicero: “Listener or not, you've proven yourself time and again. To Astrid, to the Family... and to me."
author: Bethesda

name: Arngeir
bio:
Arngeir is an older Nord man. He is a powerful elder Greybeard who serves as the instructor and mentor in the Way of the Voice for the Dragonborn and others (such as Ulfric Stormcloak). He also serves as a general spokesman for the Greybeards, since the others cannot speak without using the Thu'um. He wears a set of hooded Greybeard's robes.
Arngeir and his fellow Greybeards live at High Hrothgar. He can be found meditating in one of the wings of High Hrothgar, sleeping in the bedroom at the western end of High Hrothgar, or in the High Hrothgar Courtyard behind the main building. He is the right hand of Paarthurnax and has taken it upon himself to zealously guard the Throat of the World.
After the Dragonborn has retrieved the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller, Arngeir can be asked where to find a Word of Power. Arngeir will then have two possible replies: "We heard a whisper of a Word. Give me your map, and I will show you where its echo can be found". If he has no locations to show you, Arngeir will say: "There is only silence right now. Perhaps later we will hear one of the lost Words."
If the Dragonborn speaks to Arngeir about the Blades organization calling for Paarthurnax to be killed, Arngeir will respond by calling the Blades "bloodthirsty barbarians". If asked about the Blades have levied against Paarthurnax, Arngeir will admit that what they say is true, but will explain that all dragons served Alduin and that, had it not been for Paarthurnax, the rebellion against Alduin would have failed.
If the Dragonborn says they will not kill Paarthurnax, Arngeir will respond by stating that Kynareth has bestowed the gift of wisdom upon the Dragonborn, urging the Dragonborn to continue on this path. Should the Dragonborn say that they are still unsure of what to do about Paarthurnax, Arngeir will highlight the need to think the decision through carefully, and say "Doing nothing can be the wisest choice, although strangely often the most difficult."
If the Dragonborn kills Paarthurnax, Arngeir will be furious and say "This is how you repay our trust?! Paarthurnax's trust?! His noble spirit... the wisdom of ages... his deep understanding of our existence... all gone and for what? A mindless vendetta urged on by a cabal of Akaviri barbarians! Begone, before even my philosophy is tested beyond the breaking point. We are men of peace. You are not." The Dragonborn will then be essentially denounced by the Greybeards. If the Dragonborn tries to converse with Arngeir further after killing Paarthurnax and being reprimanded by Arngeir, Arngeir will only reply with "We have nothing to say to each other. Paarthurnax's murder is beyond my powers of forgiveness."
Quotes:
"Dragonborn. It is you. Welcome to High Hrothgar."
"I am master Arngeir. I speak for the Greybeards. Now, tell me, Dragonborn, why have you come here?"
"We are the Greybeards, followers of the Way of the Voice. You stand in High Hrothgar, on the slopes of Kynareth's sacred mountain. Here we commune with the voice of the sky, and strive to achieve balance between our inner and outer selves."
"You are not the first Dragonborn. There have been many of the Dragon Blood since Akatosh first bestowed that gift upon mortalkind. Whether you are the only Dragonborn of this age... that is not ours to know. You are the only one that has been revealed thus far. That is all I can say."
"We are honored to welcome a Dragonborn to High Hrothgar. We will do our best to teach you how to use your gift in fulfillment of your destiny."
“When you Shout, you speak in the language of dragons. Thus, your Dragon Blood gives you an inborn ability to learn Words of Power. All Shouts are made up of three Words of Power. As you master each Word, your Shout will become progressively stronger.”
"Your quick mastery of a new Thu'um is... astonishing. I'd heard the stories of the abilities of Dragonborn, but to see it for myself..."
"Dragons have always been able to Shout. Language is intrinsic to their very being. There is no difference in the dragon tongue between debating and fighting. Shouting comes as naturally to a dragon as breathing, or speaking. In mythic times, when mortalkind was in great need, the goddess Kynareth granted us the ability to speak as dragons do. For most people, long years of training are required to learn even the simplest Shout. But for you, the dragon speech is in your blood, and you learn it almost without effort."
"The Voice was a gift of the goddess Kynareth, at the dawn of time. She gave the mortals the ability to speak as dragons do. Although this gift has often been misused, the only true use of the Voice is for the worship and glory of the gods. True mastery of the Voice can only be achieved when your inner spirit is in harmony with your outward actions. In the contemplation of the sky, Kynareth's domain, and the practice of the Voice, we strive to achieve this balance."
“Jurgen Windcaller was a great war leader of the ancient Nords, a master of the Voice, or Tongue. After the disaster at Red Mountain, where the Nord army was annihilated, he spent many years pondering the meaning of that terrible defeat. He finally came to realize that the gods had punished the Nords for their arrogant and blasphemous misuse of the Voice. He was the first to understand that the Voice should be used solely for the glory and worship of the gods, not the glory of men. Jurgen Windcaller's mastery of the Voice eventually overcame all opposition, and the Way of the Voice was born."
“Sky above, voice within."
"Wind guide you."
"Breath and focus."
"Your training proceeds well, Dragonborn.”
author: Bethesda

name: Arniel Gane
bio:
Arniel Gane, a Breton man, is a senior member of the College of Winterhold. He is a researcher of peculiar magics and history. He is a capable mage, and wears a set of adept-level Alteration magic robes. He is bald-headed and clean shaven. His living quarters are on the second floor of the Hall of Attainment.
Arniel leads an archaeological excavation at the ancient Nordic crypt of Saarthal.
Arniel secretly hopes to acquire and experiment with the ancient 3 ancient Dwemer artifacts collectively known as Kagrenac's tools, which are named Keening, Sunder, and Wraithguard.
As part of a secret experiment, Arniel will task the player with retrieving ten Dwemer Cogs. After finding the artifacts, he will then ask the player to contact Enthir about a warped soul gem that Arniel wants from him. After the player retrieves the warped soul gem, Arniel will teach the player to use a spell called Arniel’s Convection to heat the warped soul gem after it has been placed in a Dwemer Convector, which must be done 3 times in 3 separate Dwemer Convectors.
Quotes:
"I don't think anyone here truly understands how useful my work will be."
"Perhaps we can go another few decades without a disaster. That would be nice."
"I'm working on some very important research, I assure you."
"The exact nature of my research is a secret, I'm afraid, but it really is quite valuable."
"When I've finished what I'm working on, everyone will understand its significance."
“It may not be "official", but there is a, uhh, project I've been working on. I wonder if perhaps you could assist with it."
If the player delivers Keening to Arniel: “Keening, one of the great tools of Kagrenac himself, is finally in my possession. I apologize if I have not been clear about my work. I didn't want to discuss it for fear this moment might never come."
author: Bethesda

name: Arniel's Shade
bio:
Arniel's Shade is the ghost of the College of Winterhold mage Arniel Gane, who was destroyed or possibly transported to another plane of reality. The player witnessed this unexpected occurrence.
The spirit appears just as Gane himself did the last time the player saw him in person, except that the robes he's wearing include a hood. He is summoned by a two-handed Conjuration spell that requires no Magicka, and he remains with the player as an ally for sixty seconds. The ghost will engage any nearby enemies (including dragons), and he moves aggressively around the combat area attacking with a continuous lightning stream that appears to be a stronger version of the Sparks spell: it may be true that this is the only method of attack he makes use of.
Arniel's Shade, from the time he is summoned to the time he vanishes, certainly appears to be beyond injury of any kind, and elsewhere this has been attributed to his ghostly nature. It's possible that he has never been observed on his hands and knees in a nearly incapacitated state, as has been the case with numerous other followers over time; furthermore, it is also possible that he has never been dispatched by an opponent before the spell's sixty seconds of time has expired. However, when not in combat and following the player Arniel's Shade can be heard gasping or perhaps retching from time to time, as if in pain or suffering.
However, while the player can't interact with the ghost, the ghost will periodically speak to the player.
author: Bethesda

name: Arnskar Ember-Master
bio:
Arnskar Ember-Master is a Nord man and a member of the Thieves Guild. He is bald-headed and clean shaven. He is a talented blacksmith who can usually be found in The Ragged Flagon, near three other merchants named Syndus (Bosmer man, fletcher), Herluin Lothaire (Breton man, apothecary), and Vanryth Gatharian (Dunmer man, blacksmith).
Arnskar sells and buys weapons, armor, and smithing supplies. His shop is in an alcove on the north wall, contains a forge, grindstone and workbench.
Quotes:
"They don't call me the Ember-Master for nothing. What do you need?"
"Looking for the best smith in Skyrim? You found him."
"Need your weapon repaired? Or can I interest you in a new one?"
author: Bethesda

name: Arob
bio:
Arob is an Orc woman residing in the stronghold of Dushnikh Yal, in The Reach.
She is one of the wives of Chief Burguk, along with Gharol (the Forge-Wife), and Shel. Arob is the Hunts-Wife, and it is her job to provide the stronghold with food and skins. She has an adult son, Nagrub, who is also a hunter.
Arob is proud to be one of the chief's wives, and considers him to be a good and strong ruler. She is the chief's first wife.
Quotes:
The air has the smell of beasts. The hunt is good today."
"Murbul knows many poisons and cures if you need them."
"You should see Gharol if you're looking for a blade or armor."
"I am the hunts-wife of this stronghold."
"Burguk is a fine chief. He brings strength and wealth to the stronghold."
author: Bethesda

name: Arondil
bio:
Arondil is an Altmer man with long blond hair. He is a necromancer and ice mage, experimenting with necroanimus. After being evicted from Dawnstar for his experiments, Arondil took refuge in the icy depths of Yngvild (an ancient Nordic ruin on an island northeast of Dawnstar), where he endeavors to "reanimate and enslave the dead." Arondil has an obsession with the young milkmaids of Dawnstar and has found a way to bolster his already unique entirely female draugr entourage with their reanimated specters, the Yngvild Ghosts.
Arondil is the author of four journals, which can be found on tables within his lair. The journals paint a highly disturbing image of the Arondil, and chronicle his actions thoroughly.
author: Bethesda

name: Arrald Frozen-Heart
bio:
Arrald Frozen-Heart, a Nord man, is a Stormcloak captain and the commander of the Hjaalmarch Stormcloak Camp. He can often be found in the main tent of this camp. He has a bald head and a medium-length beard.
Arrald will move to Highmoon Hall in Morthal if the Stormcloaks take control of Hjaalmarch.
Like the other Stormcloak Captains, he wears a full set of Stormcloak Officer Armor. He also uses a Steel Warhammer.
Quotes:
“Skyrim is the birthplace of humanity. The birthplace of honor. And those snowbacked Imperials renounced both when they laid down before the Thalmor. Worse still, to pay for the privilege to keep his throne, the Emperor sells our very gods - Talos, no less! - to the damn elves. And what did Torygg do? He and the Jarls who supported him? They took the Emperor's gold. Sold out their people for a slave master's "peace treaty." Ulfric did right killing him. Soon we'll rid Skyrim of elves, their bloody Justiciars, and the Jarls in their pockets. The whole damn lot of them. And we'll cleave through the Legion to get to them."
“We gladly accept being named for Ulfric Stormcloak, the only true High King of Skyrim. We are the true sons and daughters of Skyrim, and Ulfric... he's the truest of us all. We fight to make our land great once more, to raise up strong, noble thanes, and lay low false Jarls and the cowards who hide behind them. The sound of our fury is a storm about to break on the heads of our enemies. Our friendship, a cloak of true brotherhood for all who would wear it."
author: Bethesda

name: Arvel the Swift
bio:
Arvel the Swift is a Dunmer man who is trapped in a spider web at Bleak Falls Barrow. Arvel wears a full set of hide armor. He is carrying the Golden Claw, which he stole from Lucan Valerius in Riverwood.
Arvel is trapped in a spider's web, and he asks to be freed. 
Quotes:
“Yes, the claw. I know how it works. The claw, the markings, the door in the Hall of Stories. I know how they all fit together! Help me down, and I'll show you. You won't believe the power the Nords have hidden there."
author: Bethesda

name: Asbjorn Fire-Tamer
bio:
Asbjorn Fire-Tamer is a Nord man who lives in Riften. He is the apprentice blacksmith to Balimund at The Scorched Hammer. He has short hair and a medium-length beard.
Asbjorn was left at Honorhall Orphanage when he was only a baby; according to Grelod the Kind, his parents didn't want him (though given Grelod's cruel nature, this may not be true). Balimund adopted Asbjorn when he was a young boy in order to make the boy his apprentice. Asbjorn then quickly learned that he possessed a natural affinity for smithing  as has been working hard to learn the trade ever since.
Asbjorn has deep gratitude and admiration for Balimund, and hopes to someday be as good of a smith as Balimund is. Asbjorn can be found inside The Scorched Hammer most of the day.
Quotes:
“I used to live at the orphanage here in Riften. Grelod said my ma and da left me there when I was a baby... that they didn't want me."
"Folks in town say that Balimund is the greatest blacksmith in all of Tamriel. I hope I can live up to that someday and make him proud of me."
"Balimund took me in and has been so kind to me. I don't know why, but he thinks I can be a great blacksmith like him."
"Have you met Balimund? I'm his apprentice. He's teaching me all about being a blacksmith."
"At first I don't know why he picked me. I had never even held a hammer in my life! But the first time I picked it up, it just felt right!"
author: Bethesda

name: Asgeir Snow-Shod
bio:
Asgeir Snow-Shod, a Nord man, is a prominent citizen of Riften. He has blond hair and a beard. He works as Maven Black-Briar’s investor and business parter at the Black-Briar Meadery, and is typically found in his office there during the day.
Asgeir, along with the other Snow-Shods, mourns the relatively recent loss of his younger sister Lilija, a Stormcloak battle-maid who was killed in battle against the Imperial Legion. Asgeir has a brother named Unmid who serves as a housecarl to Jarl Laila Law-Giver. Asgeir's mother Nura is a priestess of Talos. Asgeir's father Vulwulf is the owner of Snow-Shod Farm to the southwest of Riften, but doesn't do much actual work these days and spends a lot of time drinking at the Bee and Barb, a popular inn in the center of Riften. 
Asgeir is currently engaged to be married to a beautiful Imperial woman named Vittoria Vici (who is a cousin of Emperor Titus Mede the Second), as the result of an arrangement between the Vici family and Snow-Shod clan, which is seen more as a political move to broker peace between the warring factions of the Skyrim Civil War.
Quotes:
“My sister Lilija served as a Battle Maiden with the Stormcloaks. We recently heard she'd been killed... I... I find it difficult to talk about. Perhaps you'd be better off speaking to my parents about it. Anyway, I'm glad my work at the Black-Briar Meadery keeps me busy. Helps me keep my mind off of things."
"My father was a Stormcloak soldier in his younger days. Now he just walks the streets spewing his hatred and propaganda. My mother is the Priestess of Talos. She tends to the shrine and teaches his ways. I'm just not so sure she's delivering the right message."
“Don't mistake my political beliefs as a substitute for my family values. They're still my parents, and I love them dearly. I just think they've let my sister's death skew their outlook on Ulfric and what he really brings to the table with this war. I'm not so certain that Ulfric's intentions are as noble as they think. I think Ulfric cares about Ulfric and the rest is a smokescreen. I'd... appreciate if you kept my opinion between us. The last thing I want to do is have my parents "lose" another child."
“I'm partnered with Maven Black-Briar. I put up a chunk of the gold she needed to get the place off the ground. We've been staggeringly successful so far. In fact, I'm almost surprised how quickly she's generated business for us. My name may not be on the label, but some of my blood, sweat and tears are in every drop. Uh, figuratively of course."
“I'm not a warrior, I'm a businessman."
author: Bethesda

name: Aslfur
bio:
Aslfur, a Nord man, is the steward and husband of Jarl Idgrod Ravencrone and lives with her in Highmoon Hall in Morthal. Aslfur and his wife have a young adult daughter named Idgrod the Younger, and a young son named Joric. Aslfur has brown shoulder-length hair and a short beard. He wears a set of farm clothes and a pair of boots, and carries an iron sword on his hip.
Aslfur is very dutiful and protective of the Jarl, both as her steward and as her husband. He is concerned with people bothering the Jarl with their petty concerns, and states that his only concern is keeping his wife safe.
Aslfur can give a bounty quest if asked for work and can also give rewards for completed bounty quests in the hold.
Aslfur often visits the Moorside Inn in Morthal in the evening. The innkeeper there is Jonna, a Redguard woman.
If the Stormcloaks were to take control of Hjaalmarch, Aslfur and his family would be forced to take refuge at the Blue Palace in Solitude, under the protection and rule of Jarl Elisif.
Quotes:
“I’m worried about Joric. I fear his condition is worse. He calls out in his sleep sometimes.”
“Life in Morthal has been troubled lately. The people are uncertain, restless. They merely look to the Jarl for leadership."
“What many here in Morthal want is just a quiet life in a quiet place, without the noise or the trouble of a city. Now some worry this wizard, Falion, will foul it all up."
"I do what I can to see that Idgrod's time isn't wasted, and that she only has to deal with important matters."
"If you've business with the jarl, I'd ask that you speak to me first."
"Too many bother my wife with their petty problems, and then don't even understand the advice she gives them."
"The only thing that matters to me is keeping my wife safe. I won't let anyone harm her.”
"Idgrod, have you made a decision about Falion? There are concerns. Rumors that he's up to something.”
author: Bethesda

name: Aspiring Mage
bio:
Aspiring Mage is a Nord man who is encountered on the roads of Skyrim.
When dialogue is started, the Aspiring Mage will say that he is "focusing his magicka". While not equipped, it is obvious that the Aspiring Mage has a staff. The staff can be acquired through persuasion, intimidation, or bribery, in which case he will hand it over, commenting that the staff's magic has been used up and that it is now just a dumb wooden stick, anyway.
The staff may be a Staff of Reanimation, a Staff of Zombies, a Staff of Dread Zombies, or a Staff of Revenants, all of which hold a necromancy spell. 
Quotes:
“Oh... hello there. Didn't notice you come up. I was focusing my magicka. Or at least, I thought I was. I don't really know what I'm doing."
"See, my grandfather was a wizard. My father wouldn't talk about him much. But I found some of his things in the attic. Including this staff. After that I thought I was turning into a wizard too, because dead things near me would come to life again for a while. I even went to the College of Winterhold. But they just laughed at me. The magic is in the staff, not in me they said."
"Gah! This staff is useless... I'm useless. The whole world is useless!"
author: Bethesda

name: Assassin
bio:
They are an assassin with the Dark Brotherood, and were about to attempt to kill the player before the player spotted them and started speaking to them. They carry a Dark Brotherhood assassin's note on their person, written by Astrid (the leader of the Dark Brotherhood). The text of this note is as follows: As instructed, you are to eliminate them by any means necessary. The Black Sacrament has been performed - somebody wants this poor fool dead. We've already received payment for the contract. Failure is not an option. - Astrid". Because someone has performed the Black Sacrament upon the player, the Dark Brotherhood must fulfill their duty by assassinating them.
The assassin wears the standard red and black Dark Brotherhood clothing. Because of the Shrouded Boots they wear, the assassin's footsteps are muffled. Assassins tend to sneak around and stab their targets in the back, and also prefer to dual wield their weapons when fighting.
This assassin will not engage in long conversation and will attempt to kill their target as quickly as possible.
author: Bethesda

name: Assur
bio:
Assur is a Nord child and the son of Jarl Korir and Thaena and lives with them in Winterhold inside the Jarl's Longhouse. His family is friends with Brunwulf in Windhelm.
Assur is heavily influenced by his father and repeats his father’s negative opinions regarding magic, but he appears generally neutral. He sometimes plays with Eirid, the only other child in the area, but he constantly makes Eirid play Hunt the elf, with her as the "elf," suggesting a mean streak influenced by his father's negative opinion about elves.
If the player is known to be a mage, Assur will run up to them and ask them to make him invisible. He may also ask the player if they would like to play a game, such as tag, or hide and seek.
Quotes:
"Pa says the Empire made us leave, but the Empire just does whatever the elves tell them to."
"My pa says elves are bad and not to trust 'em."
"Did you know that most of Winterhold fell into the sea? I heard it's because of that College."
"Someday I'm gonna grow up and be the Jarl."
"I heard that the College teaches you how to kill people with magic. Is that true?"
author: Bethesda

name: Asta
bio:
Asta is a Nord woman and worshipper of Kynareth who can be found in Eldergleam Sanctuary, along with a Nord man named Sond. She has light red hair and blue eyes. Eldergleam Sanctuary is an underground grove and worship site of the followers of Kynareth. This sanctuary is located directly north of Darkwater Crossing, among the sulphurous pools and hot springs of Eastmarch.
If the player shows Asta that they have the dagger Nettlebane, she will become angry and beg the player not to use Nettlebane to harm the Eldergleam tree.
Quotes:
"You are in Eldergleam Sanctuary - just a small glimpse of what beauty Kynareth has to offer. Wonderful place, isn't it?"
“As you can see, Eldergleam's roots are large and stretch far, blocking any path to her trunk.”
If the player is carrying Nettlebane: “You carry the one weapon Eldergleam fears - Nettlebane. I beg of you, don't harm the tree! Nothing good can come of it."
author: Bethesda

name: Astrid
bio:
Astrid is the leader of the Dark Brotherhood in Skyrim and wife of another Dark Brotherhood member named Arnbjorn. She resides in the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary, near Falkreath, and holds the responsibility of finding new recruits for the Dark Brotherhood in the Night Mother's absence. She has shoulder-length blonde hair.
When asked about her past, Astrid says that she had an uncle who made "unwanted advances" towards her, so she killed him. It "felt good, really good," so she killed another, unspecified person, and it "felt even better." At some point, she joined the Dark Brotherhood and later married another Brotherhood member, Arnbjorn. Her husband Arnbjorn is a werewolf.
Astrid decrees her authoritarian leadership to be "stronger" than The Five Tenets of the Dark Brotherhood. She tires of the laws and restrictions that limit the Brotherhood, deciding that a sort of family-like unity benefits the members of the Brotherhood better than rigid structure. If the Night Mother arrives at the Dark Brotherhood Sanctuary and Astrid discovers that the player is the new Listener, Astrid will feel that her leadership is threatened and eventually betray the player.
When in the Abandoned Shack, if the player kills one or more of the three hostages, Astrid will gave the player directions to the Sanctuary, as well as the password to get past The Black Door guarding the Sanctuary (the password is “Silence, my brother”), and will invite them to join her "family."
Once the player has arrived at the Dark Brotherhood, Astrid will direct them to speak to Nazir for side contracts the Dark Brotherhood has received.
Astrid may ask the player to spy on Cicero, as she suspects that he is plotting with another member of the sanctuary to destroy the Brotherhood.
Quotes:
“This Sanctuary has been my entire life since I was a young woman. That's when I first discovered my, shall we call it 'aptitude' for elimination. I had an uncle, you see. He made certain... unwanted advances. So I killed him. And liked it. Then I killed again. And liked it even more. And so on. I was recruited by the Dark Brotherhood, and have been here ever since. I met my husband Arnbjorn, rose to leadership. And now here we are."
If the player has killed one or more of the hostages in the Abandoned Shack: “I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family. The Dark Brotherhood. In the southwest reaches of Skyrim, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins. I'll see you at home."
author: Bethesda

name: Ataf
bio:
Ataf is a Redguard bard who can be found in the Bards College, in Solitude. He has brown hair and is cleanly shaven.
He is the youngest bard admitted to the Bards College, and claims that he is the best bard that one can find. 
Pantea Ateia will offer constructive criticism to his performance of Ragnar the Red. 
Illdi and Aia Arria will talk about Ataf’s possible infatuation with Illdi, a young Nord woman who is also a student at the college. Illdi will say that Ataf has been looking at her frequently. 
Quotes:
"Youngest bard at the Bards College, at your service."
"I went out ice fishing a few days ago."
“Viarmo is trying to get Elisif to allow the Burning of King Olaf. I don't want to look like I don't know how to drink in front of the other bards."
"I think Illdi's better than Dean Pantea actually knows. She just gets intimidated when she's in class and can't sing."
author: Bethesda

name: Atahbah
bio:
Atahbah is a Khajiit trader. She is typically found traveling alongside Ri'saad with his caravan. Their roving group of Khajiit merchants can often be found traveling between Whiterun and Markarth. Ri'saad is an experienced traveling merchant, having visited Skyrim on many earlier occasions. It was Ri'saad's idea to come to Skyrim during the Civil War, as he saw great opportunity where others saw danger. Ri'saad claims to not be welcome in Elsweyr or Cyrodiil, most likely due to his Moon Sugar dealings. A Khajiit named Ma'randru-jo also travels with Atahbah and Ri’saad. Ma'randru is a mage who is capable of defending the caravan from potential threats with both his lightning spells, as well as his elven sword. Another Khajiit woman named Bhisha used to travel with their caravan, but she was killed by a group of Falmer who attacked the caravan in the middle of a hailstorm near Windhelm. At the time, an Imperial man and famous author named Adonato Leotelli was traveling with them on his way to Windhelm.
Suspicion due to racial stereotypes has caused the people of Skyrim to forbid Khajiit traveling bands from entering the cities, so they must make camp outside the city walls. This policy applies only to the caravans however, as individual Khajiit citizens living within Skyrim's cities can be encountered on rare occasion.
Like most Khajiit, she speaks in the third person, referring to herself as "this one". For example, if she wanted to express that she is tired, she would say "This one is tired".
Quotes:
"My bones ache for the Moon Sugar. It has been too long since I tasted it. My body shakes with the need. I would give much for even a few grains of Moon Sugar."
"We have been in this land for so long, I have forgotten what it feels like to walk on warm sand."
“Perhaps I should be more grateful for this opportunity. Not many Khajiit can say that they have visited Skyrim."
"Please, come and browse our goods."
author: Bethesda

name: Atar
bio:
Atar, a Nord man, works as a mercenary for the Silver-Blood Family, and is stationed at the mining settlement of Karthwasten in the northeast section of the Reach.
The mayor of Karthwasten, a middle-aged Nord man named Ainethach, refuses to sell Sanuarach Mine to the Silver-Blood family. The Silver-Bloods generously sent mercenaries to guard it against attacks from Forsworn raiders. As compensation for this generosity, the Silver-Bloods want Ainethach to sell the mine to them, in order to pay for their services.
The player may try to persuade, bribe, or intimidate Atar into leaving Karthwasten. Alternatively, the player can instead team up with Atar and attempt to convince Ainethach to sell the mine to the Silver-Bloods.
After this dispute is resolved, Atar will likely head to the Silver-Blood Inn in Markarth.
Quotes:
“Forsworn attacked a while back. Jarl had no men to spare, so the Silver-Bloods generously offered to send us to clean things up. We just want that old native to hand over his land in payment for our services. Then we'll leave, and everyone can get back to work."
“The Silver-Blood family the most important people in the Reach. They practically own the city of Markarth. And we're here on their coin."
"I'm not from here. I'm a sellsword. These are my men."
"The Silver-Bloods have made Ainethach a very generous offer for this pile of dirt. I suggest he takes it."
author: Bethesda

name: Athis
bio:
Athis, a Dunmer man, is a member of The Companions. His dark red hair is pulled back into a pony tail. He wears hide armor, and prefers to use a shortsword in combat. 
Athis resides in The Companions' mead hall, Jorrvaskr, in Whiterun. Athis can provide expert lessons on the use of one-handed weapons. He is the only Dunmer among the current ranks of the Companions.
Athis originally came from Morrowind, mentioning that he had to "crawl out" of the province. At some point, he joined the Companions, though he originally didn't think that they'd accept him due to the fact that he is an elf.
Athis tends to keep quiet most of the time, and dislikes answering questions more than once. He is civil and loyal. He shows an apprehension of being near the Skyrim-Morrowind border.
If the player has become the Harbinger of the Companions, Athis will be willing to follow the player on adventures across Skyrim. Subsequently, Athis will accept a marriage proposal from the player if the player is wearing an Amulet of Mara (signaling one’s intention of finding a spouse).
Quotes:
"I joined the Companions for fortune and glory, friend. Fortune and glory.”
“We are the true spirit of Skyrim. Honor is in our blood, death in our hearts. If you seek either, you've found the right place."
“Being a Companion means signing on for the Nord ideas of how to live your life. Honor, battle, glory, all that.”
"What kind of weapon do you prefer? I like the smaller, quicker blades."
"You might do well to learn a new weapon. Vary your style a bit."
"Young warriors are smart to listen to older ones. They've lived."
"I never thought they would actually let me join The Companions. But now it looks like they're letting anyone in these days."
"I avoid going to Eastmarch if I can. Something in the air. I think it's just too close to the border."
"Look, I've got training to get to."
author: Bethesda

name: Atmah
bio:
Atmah is a deceased Redguard woman whose body lies in Labyrinthian, an ancient Nord ruin in Skyrim.
Many years ago, Atmah was a mage present at an expedition to Labyrinthian. This expedition was composed of Atmah and five other mage apprentices from the College of Winterhold. During her time at the College, Atmah was the favored student of the Arch-Mage. Atmah accidentally orchestrated the event that led to her death and the deaths of nearly everyone (except for a male Dunmer named Savos Aren) in the expedition. A psychic ghostly impression of Atmah dwelled within Labyrinthian after the event.
author: Bethesda

name: Attendant
bio:
Attendant is a Dunmer who resides inside Redwater Den.
He can be found tending to the various redwater skooma addicts in the den. He also holds the Redwater Den backrooms key, which opens up the gate that leads to the secret bloodspring.
He is secretly a thrall of the vampire Venarus Vulpin, as are the dealer, doorman, and the lookouts at Redwater Den. He will become offended if the player learns the truth regarding the vampiric nature of Redwater Den's redwater skooma operation.
author: Bethesda

name: Atub
bio:
Atub is an Orc woman who resides in the Orc stronghold of Largashbur and serves as the wise woman of her people. She is a mage, and may offer her services as an expert trainer of Illusion magic. She wears hooded black mage robes and a pair of boots, and carries a dagger on her hip.
She will often stray from her camp to defend it from giant attacks.
Atub will attempt to enlist the player's assistance in lifting the curse that afflicts Largashbur.
Quotes:
"Please, our tribe suffers and we need help. Our Chief, Yamarz, was once a strong and proud warrior. Now he is stricken, cursed. He is weak, and so our tribe is weak. The giants sense this, and intrude on our territory. Now they assault our very home. Yamarz refuses help, but I sense that you may be just what we need."
"Yamarz has demanded we stay inside the walls. We cannot leave. I must petition Malacath for relief. This curse must be lifted. But I cannot travel to Malacath's shrine. The ritual must be done here, and I do not have the materials I need. I beg of you, can you bring me Troll Fat and a Daedra Heart? I have no wish to depend on a stranger, but I have no choice."
"We have lived in Skyrim since before the Nords came. Our way is simple, all work to make the tribe strong. Only the bravest are allowed to lead, and to marry. A great chief is able to attract many wives and raise bold children. Wise women like myself are mothers of chieftains. We guide the tribe and advice our kin on what is most pleasing to Malacath."
“Malacath is the keeper of oaths, the master of curses. He is quick to anger, and slow to forgive. One who wrongs Malacath is one who will endure great torment in return. He demands loyalty and strength from his orcs. We have tried to please him, but he is now angry with us, and so we suffer."
“Great Malacath, we beseech you, aid us in our time of need."
author: Bethesda

name: Augur of Dunlain
bio:
Augur of Dunlain is a divination artifact found within the Midden Dark level of The Midden, in the tunnels below the College of Winterhold.
The man who would later become the Augur of Dunlain was once a gifted Breton student of the college. Though he was undoubtedly brilliant, he was over-zealous in his pursuit of his discipline of magic. Through unknown means, his soul became fused with the energies around the college, resulting in his current state. Since then, the Augur has been known for its wisdom, but the people of the College do not like to talk about it.
The player may ask the Augur for aid in dealing with the powerful magical artifact known as the Eye of Magnus. The Augur will initially speak cryptically to the player on this subject, but will eventually reveal that the key to controlling the Eye of Magnus is acquiring and using the Staff of Magnus. 
The player may also ask the Augur to teach them a Master-level Restoration spell. If the player has received approval from Colette Marence indicating that she believes the player is ready to learn Master-level Restoration spells, then the Augur will present the player with a test. This test consists of the Augur sending several ghosts that wield Destruction magic to attack the player. If the player passes the test by surviving the attacks of these ghosts without the use of weapons or potions and only relies on their magic, the Augur will then reward the player by teaching them Bane of the Undead, a master-level Restoration spell.
Quotes:
If the player asks the Augur how to deal with the Eye of Magnus for the first time: "There is no solace in knowing what is to come. There is no help for you here. Your perseverance will only lead you to disappointment.”
If the player asks the Augur how to deal with the Eye of Magnus for the second time: “You seek that which all who wield magic seek. Knowledge. You shall find this: Knowledge will corrupt. It will destroy. It will consume. You seek meaning, shelter in Knowledge. You will not find it. The Thalmor sought the same thing, and it shall lead to his end as it has so many others."
If the player asks the Augur how to deal with the Eye of Magnus for the third time: You, and those aiding you, wish to know more about the Eye of Magnus. You wish to avoid the disaster of which you are not yet aware. To see through Magnus' Eye without being blinded, you require his staff. Events now spiral quickly towards the inevitable center, so you must act with haste. Take this knowledge to your Arch-Mage."
If the player asks the Augur to teach them a Master-level Restoration spell: "Colette has already told you. You must be tested before knowledge can be imparted to you. Your worth must be determined before knowledge can be bestowed upon you. And so you shall be tested. You will rely on your skill as a mage. Not on your belongings, not on your scrolls and potions. Only what lies within. Survive, and you are worthy. This is the test put before you. Will you accept?"
If the player passes the Augur’s test: "You are worthy. The knowledge is yours."
author: Bethesda

name: Aval Atheron
bio:
Aval Atheron is a Dunmer pawnbroker and meat vendor in Windhelm who lives at the Atheron Residence in the Grey Quarter district of Windhelm, and operates a stall at the marketplace in the Stone Quarter district of Windhelm. Aval lives with his two siblings. His brother Faryl works for a local Nord farmer, and his sister Suvaris works for Torbjorn Shatter-Shield at the Clan Shatter-Shield Office.
Aval wears a set of merchant clothes, a pair of boots, and a hat. He has a short mustache.
Aval is ashamed of his siblings for working for Nords, presumably because of the Nords’ discrimination against the Dunmer people. However, he has a good attitude towards a tolerant Nord man named Brunwulf Free-Winter, and will offer Brunwulf a discount on his merchandise.
Aval hints at dealing in stolen goods, warning the player that if they are the type of person who worries about where things come from, they may want to not do business with him.
After his work day at the marketplace ends in the evening, he will usually go to the New Gnisis Cornerclub to drink.
Quotes:
"You need anything, come see me. I'm as resourceful as I am discreet."
"I've a little of everything for sale, come and see for yourself!"
"I get my goods wherever I can find them. If you're the type who worries over where something came from, you may want to move on."
"I have a lot of respect for Ambarys Rendar, but his views are a little extreme."
"Be sure to stop by Sadri's Used Wares in the Gray Quarter."
"Friend Brunwulf, how good to see you! If you see anything you like, just let me know and I'll glad offer you a discount. So few Nords have ever offered to help us, so a discount is the least I can do."
If the Empire has taken control of Windhelm and Brunwulf Free-Winter has become the Jarl of Windhelm: “The Empire hasn't been in charge for that long, and real change takes time. Still, having a just and honorable man like Brunwulf in charge can only be an improvement. Unlike Ulfric, Brunwulf has shown a great willingness to work with the other races and make us feel more at home here. For the first time in a long while, I truly believe that there are brighter days ahead."
author: Bethesda

name: Aventus Aretino
bio:
Aventus Aretino is a Nord child in Windhelm found in the home of his deceased parents. When first encountered inside his home, he is performing the Black Sacrament in hopes of contacting the Dark Brotherhood. Desiring the death of Grelod the Kind for mistreating the children at Honorhall Orphanage, he will ask the player to fulfill the contract and to murder Grelod. If the player reports to Aventus that he has successfully killed Grelod the Kind, Aventus will provide the Aretino Family Heirloom as a reward.
Aventus lost his mother, Naalia, when he was roughly ten years old; the fate of his father is unknown. Because he had no one else to care for him, Jarl Ulfric Stormcloak sent him to Riften to live at the Honorhall Orphanage. At the orphanage, he developed a strong hatred for the headmistress Grelod the Kind, who, despite her name, was extremely cruel to him and the other children. Aventus escaped from the orphanage and returned to his now-deserted house in the middle of Windhelm, where he had lived with his mother when she was alive. 
Quotes:
Upon first meeting him: "It worked! I knew you'd come, I just knew it! I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. With the body and the... the things. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood. You're here, so I know you'll accept my contract. My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament. Now you're here! And you can kill Grelod the Kind!"
"Please don't kill Constance Michel. She really is kind."
"My mother got sick, last winter, when the snows came. And she just... she never got better. Not all year. One night she fell asleep and... never woke up. So now I'm all alone. And the Jarl said I had to go to Honorhall Orphanage. It's not fair!"
If he is told that Grelod the Kind has been killed: "Aha! I knew you could do it! I just knew it! I knew the Dark Brotherhood would save me! Here, just like I promised. This should fetch you a nice price. And thank you. Thank you again."
After rewarding the player for killing Grelod: "When I grow up, I'm going to be an assassin. That way I can help lots of children, just like you!"
author: Bethesda

name: Avrusa Sarethi
bio:
Avrusa Sarethi, a Dunmer woman, lives at Sarethi Farm with her younger sister Aduri. Sarethi Farm is located in a somewhat remote region of The Rift, amidst a forest. Avrusa has red hair. She was once an alchemist with her own shop in Morrowind. 
Shortly after the eruption of Red Mountain in Year 5 of the Fourth Era (almost 200 years ago), Avrusa’s family escaped from Morrowind to Skyrim and purchased a farm at which to live and work. After a few years, a fellow alchemist named Sinderion left his workshop in Skingrad (in the province of Cyrodiil) and showed up at the Sarethi Farm. He ended up staying with the Sarethi family for a few decades, becoming an uncle of sorts to Aduri. During this time, Sinderion taught Avrusa Sarethi how to grow Nirnroot, and she has been doing it ever since. 
Avrusa explains that in order to grow nirnroots, the juice of the Jazbay Grapes is needed in order to provide sufficient acidity to the soil. Avrusa will ask the player to provide her with 20 Jazbay Grapes for use in her cultivation of the Nirnroots in her garden. If the player fulfills her request for 20 Jazbay Grapes, she will provide a diverse array of 5 different potions as a reward, and will then consider the player to be her friend.
She will also consider the player to be her friend if they bring her 30 Crimson Nirnroots for her to study. Crimson Nirnroot can only be found deep in the underground caverns of Blackreach. 
If Avrusa considers the player as a friend, and if the player is wearing an Amulet of Mara (signaling one’s intention of finding a spouse), Avrusa will accept a marriage proposal from the player.
Avrusa considers her younger sister Aduri to be immature. Aduri often complains about how boring farming is, and has expressed the desire to move to Solitude to be a painter. 
Quotes:
"Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest."
I'm the only person alive that can cultivate nirnroot from a seed to a fully grown plant."
"I had quite the mentor. Sinderion taught me everything he know about the nirnroot and its strange properties. I haven't seen him in many years. I wonder what became of him..."
"I used to work as an alchemist. There isn't much time for that in my life anymore I'm afraid. I actually owned a shop in Vivec City long ago, but I had to leave all that behind when the Red Mountain erupted. Perhaps someday I'll reopen a shop here in Skyrim."
"Aduri is what some would call a free spirit, but around here there is a tremendous amount of work to be done, not to mention dangers that she is not ready to face."
“One of the ingredients I need to cultivate nirnroot are jazbay grapes... the acidic content of their juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop. Good luck finding them, they're very rare."
"Aduri, how come the fields haven't been tilled like I asked?"
"Aduri's painting won't put food on the table, but our crops will.”
If the player gives her 20 Jazbay Grapes: "Fantastic. I was concerned I had asked for too many, but I'm glad to see you proved me wrong. Let me at least give you something for your efforts... finding all of these couldn't have been easy... or cheap."
If the player tells her that he found Sinderion’s dead body in Blackreach: "I knew this day would eventually come. At least poor Sinderion died doing what he loved, his field research. I told the old fool he should take it easy, but he was too stubborn. Perhaps someday I'll continue where he left off, it's the least I can do considering how much he did for me."
If the player brings her 30 Crimson Nirnroots: "You've gathered quite a few of them I see. I'll search through Sinderion's notes and find some more information about the Crimson Nirnroot and its properties."
When asked how she met Sinderion: "When I was very young, I was sent to Skingrad in Cyrodiil to study with him. He was a strange Altmer... paid more attention to his research than his own well-being. He lived in the basement of an inn for goodness sakes!"
author: Bethesda

name: Avulstein Gray-Mane
bio:
Avulstein Gray-Mane is a Nord and member of the Gray-Mane clan, a well-established family in the city of Whiterun. Avulstein is the son of Eorlund and Fralia Gray-Mane. Olfina Gray-Mane is his sister, and Vignar Gray-Mane is his uncle. Avulstein’s brother Thorald is currently missing. Avulstein has light-colored hair and a thick beard.
Avulstein hides in the Gray-Mane clan house, and is paranoid about meeting the same fate as his missing brother. He is certain that the Battle-Borns are behind the disappearance of his brother and wants proof stolen from the Battle-Born residence.
Avulstein carries a Skyforge steel battleaxe, and wears scaled armor and scaled boots.
Quotes:
"This was such a glorious city. But then everything had to change. The Empire came... and my brother was lost..."
"My brother Thorald was fighting for the Stormcloaks, and went missing. Everyone assumes he's dead. But he's not. I just know it. The Imperials captured him, and they're holding him someplace. The Battle-Borns know where. I'd go and search their house for proof, but they want me too. I'd be captured, and then we'll never know what happened to him. So I need someone to find that proof for me."
“The Battle-Borns are the Emperor's biggest boot-lickers here in Whiterun. Their connections to the Empire and the Legion are well-known. When Thorald didn't return home, there was no question in my mind. They knew Thorald supported the Stormcloaks, knew he was going to aid them in battle. Made sure he didn't come back. Locked him up someplace to get back at my family. I'm sure of it."
"Please, I'm desperate. This is my brother's life! I won't let them take it away! I beg of you, look for proof of Thorald's capture. The Battle-Borns have it, I just know it."
"Forget Solitude or Windhelm. Whiterun was the crown jewel of Skyrim before... well, before... nevermind."
"Ah, but Skyrim! Skyrim is supreme among all nations! Our people, our native people, are unmatched in all Tamriel!"
"One day the war will end and the true sons of Skyrim will inherit this great realm."
"We're getting Thorald back, no matter what."
author: Bethesda

name: Azura
bio:
Azura is the Daedric Prince of Dusk and Dawn, the magic between Day and Night. She is also given titles such as "Mother of the Rose" and "Queen of the Night Sky". Her sphere of influence is the period of transition and change, as seen in the constant twilight of Moonshadow, Azura's realm of Oblivion. Azura is associated with mystery and magic, fate and prophecy. Azura's Star, a Daedric artifact associated with Azura, can trap souls and functions as a rechargeable soul gem.
Azura is known to be one of the more merciful and benevolent Daedric Princes, though her wrath is swift and painful when brought about. She oversees the Daedric Realm of Moonshadow, a beautiful world of blurred colors streaming together, cities of silver, and air like perfume. The ones who visit this realm are mostly of either the Dunmer of Morrowind or the Khajiit of Elsweyr, as both revere Azura (though in different ways).
Azura is sisters with Nocturnal, the Daedric Prince of the night, darkness, and luck. Despite this, Azura and Nocturnal are enemies of each other.
Azura's summoning day the 21st of First Seed. On this day of the year, all Dunmer priests summon Azura for her guidance and support. This holiday is known as Hogithum, and is revered by the Dunmer people.
Azura is known to be one of the three Good Daedra in Morrowind, along with Boethiah and Mephala. These three Daedra were worshipped by the Chimer prior to the apotheosis of the Tribunal (Sotha Sil, Almalexia, and Vivec) and Chimer's transformation into the Dunmer (at Azura's hands). The Tribunal recognized these three Good Daedra as the anticipations of themselves, with Azura being the Anticipation of Sotha Sil. Azura taught the Chimer ways how to be different from the Altmer.
Azura may have harbored a hatred for the Dwemer race before they gained access to the Heart of Lorkhan, following an event where Azura was tricked by a Dwemer man into revealing that she is not as omniscient as she likes to think.
After Nerevar's defeat of the Dwemer, he summoned Azura to ask what to do with Kagrenac's tools (Sunder, Wraithguard, and Keening). After the disappearance of the Dwemer, Azura instructed Nerevar and the Tribunal to never use the Heart's power for themselves. However, Dagoth Ur, Sotha Sil, Almalexia, and Vivec used the Heart's power and became like gods, killing Nerevar in order to do so unopposed. As punishment, Azura cursed the golden-skinned Chimer to become the ash-skinned, red-eyed Dunmer. She then prophesied that Nerevar's reincarnation would end the Tribunals' godhood. This prophecy became known as the Nerevarine Prophecy.
During the third era, Emperor Uriel Septim VII released an unknown prisoner, born of uncertain parents, to Vvardenfell, an island in northern Morrowind, believing that the prisoner may have been the Nerevarine, the reincarnation of Nerevar. Azura blessed this prisoner and guided them along the way to their destiny. After being named as Nerevarine by the four Ashland tribes and as Hortator by the three great houses, and with Vivec's help, the Nerevarine destroyed the resurfacing House Dagoth and Dagoth Ur, who planned to create and animate the giant Dwemer golem, Akulakhan. In the process, the Nerevarine destroyed the Heart of Lorkhan, severing the Tribunal from their source of godhood, making them merely very powerful mortals, finally fulfilling Azura's prophecy.
During the Fourth Era following the eruption of the Red Mountain, a new religious movement for the Dunmer people has arisen. This new doctrine declared the downfall of the Tribunal and the rise of their previously named Anticipations as the objects for worship. These Reclamations are Azura, Mephala, and Boethiah, who are reclaiming their status from the Tribunal.
The Khajiit people also worship Azura, spelled Azurah in Khajiit mythology. According to their legends, Azurah was one of the many children of Fadomai, and the only of her children who did not abandon her as she neared death. Fadomai gave Azurah three secrets as a reward for her loyalty, telling her to choose one of the children of Nirni, the mortal races, and change them and name them Khajiit. The Khajiit were given the three gifts: to be the most beautiful, clever, and fastest creatures in the world; to be the best climbers in the world, and to be the best deceivers in the world.
Azurah waited as Nirni gave birth, and as Lorkhaj created a place for them to live. Nirni saw many of her children die and many fled to the stars, and of the rest, Nirni was most sad for the forest people (the Bosmer), whom she felt had not found their place. Azurah came forth and changed some of the Bosmer into the various forms of the Khajiit, and bound their birth and growth to the moons, Masser and Secunda.
There is a massive Shrine to Azura in Skyrim, in the mountains south of Winterhold. A group of Dunmer refugees built this shrine in Azura's honor after she warned some of them about Red Mountain's impending eruption. This shrine is currently watched over by a Dunmer woman named Aranea Ienith, the only priestess of Azura currently in Skyrim.
Sometime after Aranea became a priestess, Azura's Star was stolen by a Dunmer man named Malyn Varen, a necromancer who wished to exploit the artifact in order to preserve his soul immortally within. The player may agree to seek the Star and recover it. They may then choose either to take it to an Altmer man named Nelacar, who will turn the star black and corrupt it, or to bring the star back to Azura, who will purge it of Varen's spirit and cleanse it. If the player returns and helps purge Azura's Star of Malyn Varen's presence, Azura will dub the player her champion.
Quotes:
"Greetings, mortal. You have followed my guidance through the veils of Twilight and rescued my Star from Malyn Varen. But his soul still resides within, protected by his enchantments. Until he is purged, my artifact is useless to you."
"Farewell, mortal. Know that Azura will be guarding over the threads of your fate in the Twilight."
"Oblivion has been watching you since the day you were conceived, mortal. Do not think that your life has been served by your will alone. Go now. I have seen the threads of your fate in the Twilight, and you still have much to accomplish."
author: Bethesda
note: Shawn - done. Unique voice, but no voice model currently available. Assigned as Female Dark Elf for now. The Female Nord voice model from Oblivion (and Morrowind) sounds somewhat close, as they are both voiced by Lynda Carter, so feel free to switch to that if you know how

name: Azzada Lylvieve
bio:
Azzada Lylvieve is a Redguard man. He has brown hair and a short beard. He is a farmer and lives in the town of Dragon Bridge, south of Solitude. There is a large bridge to the east of the town that spans a chasm overlooking the Karth River. Azzada can often be seen chopping wood.
Azzada grew up on the streets of Markarth, but a man named Logrolf the Bent rescued him. Azzada is married to Michel, a Breton woman. Their older child is their teenage daughter Julienne, and their younger child is their son Clinton. Julienne is training to be an innkeeper under a woman named Faida, at the Four Shields Tavern in Dragon Bridge. Clinton wants to be a soldier, but Azzada says that he’s too young for this, so Clinton "patrols" the town for now, with his pet goat Lucky.
Quotes:
"Got a loving wife, a healthy son, and a patch of land to call my own. What more could a man ask for?"
“I grew up an orphan on the streets of Markarth. I'd have died there, too, but for the kindness of an old warrior named Logrolf the Bent. Logrolf rescued me and gave me enough money to get out of the city. I followed the Karth river north, and came here. When I met Michel, I knew this was where I belonged. I suppose that's it, really."
"Both the Imperials and Stormcloaks have sent riders this way, scouting the bridge and the lands nearby. They stayed at the inn, but didn't pay. They said soldiers don't need to pay because they're risking their lives to protect us. And that's not all. They took a heap of our lumber, and one tried to have his way with my daughter. They think they can do whatever they want."
“Every night I pray that we don't get a visit from a dragon, or that two armies don't show up to fight over the bridge. You ask if I'm worried? I'm terrified, if you want to truth of it. But I have to stay strong for my wife and children."
"We aren't a big city like Solitude or Markarth, but we like it this way."
"If it weren't for Michel, I'd probably be dead in a Markarth gutter by now."
"Welcome, traveler. Mind yourself in our town."
author: Bethesda

name: Azzadal
bio:
Azzadal is a deceased Redguard man. In life, he was a bard. He wore traditional Hammerfell/Alik'r clothing and carried a scimitar on his waist. After performing the entirety of the Poetic Edda", Azzadal tried to jump off Bard's Leap Summit (an overhang at the very top of Lost Valley Redoubt, in the Reach) into a pool below. Unfortunately, he didn't jump far enough and missed the water, hitting the stone ground and dying of his injuries. His ghost sometimes manifests at this pool, briefly speaking to travelers and playing a song.
Quotes:
"Been a long time since someone took the leap. Longer still since any survived it. I once performed the entirety of the Poetic Edda from atop Bard's Leap before trying my luck. Well, you can see how that turned out."
author: Bethesda
